subject: Climate & Environment
title: Urban Heat Islands
description: Learn Urban Heat Islands in one minute.

hook.text: Cities can be 5 to 10Â°C hotter than surrounding countryside on summer nights.

buildup.text: Concrete, asphalt, and buildings absorb heat all day and radiate it back at night.

discovery.text: Few trees and little vegetation mean less shade and less cooling through evaporation.

twist.text: Air conditioning pumps indoor heat outdoors â€” making streets even hotter in a feedback loop.

climax.text: Painting roofs white and planting urban forests can drop temperatures by several degrees.

punchline.text: Cities built to keep weather out are now trapping heat in.
